meanings.definition: A person who is unwilling to spend money; a miser.
meanings.sent1: My friend is such a cheapskate that he never buys anything new.
meanings.sent2: The cheapskates at the office always bring their own lunch to save money.
meanings.sent3: The cheapskates in the movie only cared about their own wealth, not helping others.
meanings.sent4: Her father was a cheapskate, holding onto every penny as if it were gold.
meanings.sent5: The image of a cheapskate is someone who pinches pennies until they scream.

meanings.definition: To act in a stingy or miserly manner.
meanings.sent1: She cheapskates by never tipping the waitstaff at restaurants.
meanings.sent2: When times are tough, people tend to cheapskate on unnecessary expenses.
meanings.sent3: He cheapskates on gifts by always giving homemade coupons for free hugs.
meanings.sent4: The company cheapskates on employee benefits, causing dissatisfaction among workers.
meanings.sent5: The government cheapskates on public services, leading to deteriorating infrastructure.
